description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows kernel-mode driver elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-35250), follow these steps:

1. Download and apply the appropriate KB update for your Windows version from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
2. Restart your system after installation to ensure that the vulnerability is mitigated.

**Details**:
- The updates address improper restriction of operations within memory buffers and untrusted pointer dereference issues. 
- Available updates for affected builds can be found at:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5039212](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039212)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2 and 22H2 for x64: [KB5039211](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5039211)
   - Other relevant updates can be accessed through the links provided.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure your system build matches the specified versions.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with updates.
